2025-03-01.title: A Path of Discipline
2025-03-01.verse: Proverbs 10:17 - Whoever heeds instruction is on the path to life, but she who rejects correction goes astray.
2025-03-01.text: The path of a righteous woman is a path of discipline. Proverbs 10:17 reminds us: 'She who heeds instruction is on the path to life, but she who rejects correction goes astray.' Discipline is not a punishment, but a guide that leads us to a full life in Christ. As women, we often look for the easy way out, but faith calls us to self-discipline in our finances, our relationships, and, most importantly, our spiritual life. This month, the challenge is to cultivate discipline as an act of love and obedience to God. What area of your life needs more discipline? Perhaps it's your quiet time with God, your way of speaking, or your work habits. Commit today to follow the path of correction, knowing it will lead you to life.

2025-03-02.title: Serving with a Humble Heart
2025-03-02.verse: Matthew 20:26-28 - But among you it shall not be so. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant, and whoever wants to be first must be your slave—just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.
2025-03-02.text: The world's leadership is focused on power and authority, but Jesus showed us a different path. In Matthew 20:26-28, He tells us that 'whoever would be great among you must be your servant.' The true leader is a servant. As women, we are called to lead, but our leadership must be a reflection of Christ's humble service. This means putting the needs of others before our own, whether in our family, at work, or in the church. It's a leadership that doesn't seek recognition but serves silently and with joy. Who can you serve with a humble heart today? Maybe it's your family by helping with a chore, or a colleague by lending a hand. The most impactful leadership is that which is exercised on its knees, serving others.

2025-03-03.title: The Strength of Integrity
2025-03-03.verse: Proverbs 11:3 - The integrity of the upright guides them, but the crookedness of the treacherous destroys them.
2025-03-03.text: In a world where dishonesty often seems rewarded, the woman of God holds fast to integrity. Proverbs 11:3 assures us that 'The integrity of the upright guides them, but the crookedness of the treacherous destroys them.' Integrity isn't just the absence of lies; it's a consistency of character where your actions, words, and thoughts are aligned with God's truth. It is the foundation upon which a firm character is built. As women, our integrity is our most distinctive hallmark. Is there an area in your life where you are tempted to take a shortcut or compromise your values? Today, choose the path of integrity, knowing that it is the path that will guide you and give you true peace. Integrity is a fortress that cannot be broken.

2025-03-04.title: Purpose in Your Calling
2025-03-04.verse: Ephesians 2:10 - For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand, that we should walk in them.
2025-03-04.text: Our purpose in life is not something we have to create from scratch; it's something God has already prepared for us. Ephesians 2:10 reminds us, 'For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand, that we should walk in them.' As women, we often measure our purpose by personal success or ambition. However, our true purpose is in walking in the works God has prepared for us. This gives meaning to our work life, our role as wives and mothers, and every action we take. What are the 'good works' God has placed on your path today? Maybe it's an act of service, a word of encouragement, or a decision that honors God. Live with the intention of walking in God's purpose, and your life will have eternal meaning.

2025-03-05.title: The Power of Self-Denial
2025-03-05.verse: Luke 9:23 - And he said to all, “If anyone would come after me, let her deny herself and take up her cross daily and follow me.”
2025-03-05.text: Today, as Lent begins, we are reminded of Jesus's call to discipleship. Luke 9:23 tells us, 'If anyone would come after me, let her deny herself and take up her cross daily and follow me.' Self-denial is not an act of misery, but of freedom. As women, we are often slaves to our own desires, ambitions, and pleasures. Jesus invites us to set aside these burdens to follow Him. This is an act of discipline that strengthens our faith and draws us closer to Him. What can you deny yourself today? Perhaps it's setting aside a comfort, fasting from a distraction, or sacrificing some of your time to pray. Self-denial is a powerful tool to grow in the grace and likeness of Christ.

2025-03-06.title: Overcoming Temptation
2025-03-06.verse: 1 Corinthians 10:13 - No temptation has overtaken you that is not common to man. God is faithful, and he will not let you be tempted beyond your ability, but with the temptation he will also provide the way of escape, that you may be able to endure it.
2025-03-06.text: Temptation is a constant battle in every woman's life. But 1 Corinthians 10:13 gives us a powerful promise: 'No temptation has overtaken you that is not common to man. God is faithful, and he will not let you be tempted beyond your ability, but with the temptation he will also provide the way of escape, that you may be able to endure it.' This is not a license to sin, but a guarantee that God will always provide a way out. As women, we often feel shame or loneliness in the struggle against temptation. But you are not alone, and there is a way of escape. What temptation are you facing today? Instead of giving in, actively look for the 'way of escape' that God has promised. He is faithful to give you the strength to overcome.

2025-03-07.title: A Consistent Walk
2025-03-07.verse: Philippians 3:14 - I press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.
2025-03-07.text: Faith is not a sprint; it's a marathon of endurance. Philippians 3:14 challenges us to 'press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.' The key to this marathon is a consistent walk. It's not about being perfect, but about being persistent. As women, we often want to see immediate results, but spiritual growth is a gradual process that requires consistent habits. Don't let weariness or discouragement make you quit. How can you be more consistent in your walk with God? Maybe it's by praying in the morning without fail, or reading a chapter of the Bible every night. A consistent walk not only brings you closer to the goal, but also glorifies God along the way.

2025-03-08.title: Teaching a Legacy of Faith
2025-03-08.verse: Deuteronomy 6:6-7 - And these words that I command you today shall be on your heart. You shall teach them diligently to your children, and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise.
2025-03-08.text: Faith is not just a personal belief; it's a legacy we pass on to our children. Deuteronomy 6:6-7 instructs us that 'these words that I command you today shall be on your heart. You shall teach them diligently to your children, and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way...' A mother's role is not just to provide, but to be the primary spiritual leader of her home. This means living a life of authentic faith so your children see what it means to follow Christ. How can you be more intentional about teaching your children about God's Word? Maybe it's through a family devotional, a prayer before meals, or simply a conversation about God's goodness. A legacy of faith is the greatest gift you can give your family.

2025-03-09.title: Living with Intentionality
2025-03-09.verse: Ephesians 5:15-16 - Look carefully then how you walk, not as unwise but as wise, making the best use of the time, because the days are evil.
2025-03-09.text: In a world full of distractions, living with intentionality is a powerful act of faith. Ephesians 5:15-16 challenges us to 'look carefully then how you walk, not as unwise but as wise, making the best use of the time, because the days are evil.' As women, we are often tempted to live on autopilot, letting our days be consumed by busyness and a lack of focus. But God calls us to be intentional stewards of our time, our relationships, and our resources. This means having a clear sense of purpose and making deliberate choices that honor God. What are you spending your time on today? Is it bringing you closer to God and to your purpose? Take a moment to reflect and make a conscious choice to live with intentionality today.

2025-03-10.title: Humility in Leadership
2025-03-10.verse: Philippians 2:3 - Do nothing from selfish ambition or conceit, but in humility count others more significant than yourselves.
2025-03-10.text: True leadership is not about being in charge; it's about taking care of those in your charge. Philippians 2:3 challenges us to 'do nothing from selfish ambition or conceit, but in humility count others more significant than yourselves.' In a world that values self-promotion, this verse calls women to a higher standard. A humble leader doesn't see herself as superior, but as a servant who lifts others up. This is the model of leadership that Christ showed us. It's about empowering your team, your family, and your friends to reach their full potential. How can you practice humility in your leadership today? Maybe it's by giving credit to others for a job well done, asking for advice, or simply listening to a subordinate's ideas. True influence comes from a heart of humility.

2025-03-11.title: Steadfastness in Trials
2025-03-11.verse: James 1:12 - Blessed is the woman who remains steadfast under trial, for when she has stood the test she will receive the crown of life, which God has promised to those who love him.
2025-03-11.text: Life's trials can be a test of our strength and our faith. James 1:12 gives us a powerful promise: 'Blessed is the woman who remains steadfast under trial, for when she has stood the test she will receive the crown of life, which God has promised to those who love him.' This verse reminds us that our endurance is not in vain. God uses our trials to refine our character and to strengthen our faith. As women, we often want to overcome problems quickly, but God uses the process to mold us. What trial are you enduring today? Don't lose heart. Keep your eyes on Jesus and trust that He will give you the strength you need to stand the test. Your steadfastness is a testament to your love for Him.

2025-03-12.title: Peace in Humility
2025-03-12.verse: Proverbs 11:2 - When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with the humble is wisdom.
2025-03-12.text: Pride and humility are two competing forces in the heart of a woman. Proverbs 11:2 says, 'When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with the humble is wisdom.' Pride is a destructive force that can lead to conflict and emotional turmoil. It makes us think we have all the answers and that we are above reproach. But humility, on the other hand, is the pathway to wisdom and peace. A humble woman is teachable, open to correction, and trusts in God's wisdom over her own. What is a source of pride in your life today? Take a moment to humble yourself before God and others. You will find that true peace and wisdom are found not in self-exaltation, but in a humble heart that trusts in the Lord.

2025-03-13.title: Prayer and Fasting
2025-03-13.verse: Isaiah 58:6 - Is not this the fast that I choose: to loose the bonds of wickedness, to undo the straps of the yoke, to let the oppressed go free, and to break every yoke?
2025-03-13.text: Prayer and fasting are powerful spiritual disciplines that connect us to God's heart. Isaiah 58:6 describes a fast that God honors: 'Is not this the fast that I choose: to loose the bonds of wickedness, to undo the straps of the yoke, to let the oppressed go free, and to break every yoke?' Fasting is not just about abstaining from food; it's about abstaining from our own desires to focus on God's will. As women, we are called to a life of prayer and fasting, not as a show of piety, but as an act of humility and a way to seek God's direction for our lives and our world. Have you considered adding a fast to your spiritual habits this month? It could be from food, entertainment, or a distraction that takes your time away from God. Prayer and fasting are powerful tools for spiritual growth.

2025-03-14.title: Serving as a Family
2025-03-14.verse: 1 Peter 4:10 - As each has received a gift, use it to serve one another, as good stewards of God's varied grace.
2025-03-14.text: The family is a team, and we are called to serve one another and our community together. 1 Peter 4:10 reminds us, 'As each has received a gift, use it to serve one another, as good stewards of God's varied grace.' As a mother, you have the opportunity to lead your family in service. This teaches your children the importance of using their gifts for the good of others and brings your family closer together. Serving together is a powerful way to live out your faith. How can your family serve others today? Maybe it's by preparing a meal for a neighbor in need, volunteering at a local charity, or simply inviting someone over for a meal. Serving as a family is a powerful witness to the love of Christ.

2025-03-15.title: Courageous Decisions
2025-03-15.verse: Joshua 1:9 - Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be frightened, and do not be dismayed, for the Lord your God is with you wherever you go.
2025-03-15.text: True leadership requires courage. Joshua 1:9 gives us a powerful command and a promise: 'Be strong and courageous. Do not be frightened, and do not be dismayed, for the Lord your God is with you wherever you go.' As women, we are often faced with difficult decisions that require courage—decisions that can impact our family, our career, and our future. But this verse reminds us that we don't have to face these decisions alone. God is with us, and He gives us the strength to be courageous. What courageous decision are you being called to make today? Maybe it's a difficult conversation, a new career path, or a commitment to a new spiritual habit. Trust in the Lord, be strong and courageous, and He will guide you.

2025-03-16.title: Living by Faith
2025-03-16.verse: Hebrews 11:6 - And without faith it is impossible to please him, for whoever would draw near to God must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who seek him.
2025-03-16.text: Faith is the foundation of our relationship with God. Hebrews 11:6 reminds us that 'without faith it is impossible to please him, for whoever would draw near to God must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who seek him.' As women, we are often tempted to live by sight, to believe only in what we can see and control. But God calls us to live by faith, to trust in His promises even when we can't see the outcome. Living by faith is an act of courage and surrender. It's a daily choice to trust in God's goodness and His plan for our lives. What area of your life needs more faith today? Maybe it's your finances, your marriage, or your future. Trust in Him and believe that He will reward your faithfulness.

2025-03-17.title: Controlling Your Emotions
2025-03-17.verse: Proverbs 25:28 - A woman without self-control is like a city broken into and left without walls.
2025-03-17.text: A woman who cannot control her emotions is like a city without walls—vulnerable and exposed. Proverbs 25:28 says, 'A woman without self-control is like a city broken into and left without walls.' In our society, women are often told to be in control of their emotions, but God calls us to a different kind of control. This isn't about being emotionless, but about being guided by the Holy Spirit instead of our impulses. Emotional control is a sign of spiritual maturity and a key to a peaceful life. Where do you need more emotional control today? Maybe it's with your temper, your words, or your frustrations. Pray for the Holy Spirit to give you the strength to master your emotions. A woman who controls her emotions is a woman who is led by God.

2025-03-18.title: The Strength of the Spirit
2025-03-18.verse: Ephesians 6:10-11 - Finally, be strong in the Lord and in the strength of his might. Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the schemes of the devil.
2025-03-18.text: The Christian life is a spiritual battle, and we need spiritual strength to fight it. Ephesians 6:10-11 encourages us to 'be strong in the Lord and in the strength of his might. Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the schemes of the devil.' Our strength does not come from our own power, but from God's. The armor of God—truth, righteousness, peace, faith, salvation, and the Word—is our defense against the attacks of the enemy. As women, we are called to be spiritual warriors, and this strength is essential for our families and our communities. Are you wearing your spiritual armor today? Take a moment to pray and put on each piece of God's armor. Stand firm in the strength of the Lord, and you will be able to overcome.

2025-03-19.title: A Life of Sacrifice
2025-03-19.verse: Romans 12:1 - I appeal to you therefore, sisters, by the mercies of God, to present your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and acceptable to God, which is your spiritual worship.
2025-03-19.text: Sacrifice is an act of worship and a sign of a disciplined life. Romans 12:1 challenges us to 'present your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and acceptable to God, which is your spiritual worship.' This is not a one-time event, but a daily commitment to lay down our own will and desires for the sake of God's will. As women, we are called to a life of sacrifice—sacrificing our time for our families, our comfort for the good of others, and our ambitions for God's purposes. What sacrifice is God calling you to make today? It may be small, but a life of small sacrifices leads to a life of great spiritual growth. A life of sacrifice is a life that truly worships God.

2025-03-20.title: Godly Ambition
2025-03-20.verse: Colossians 3:23-24 - Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men, knowing that from the Lord you will receive the inheritance as your reward. You are serving the Lord Christ.
2025-03-20.text: Ambition can be a powerful motivator, but it must be rooted in God's will. Colossians 3:23-24 gives us a clear guide for godly ambition: 'Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men, knowing that from the Lord you will receive the inheritance as your reward. You are serving the Lord Christ.' This verse reminds us that our work, our goals, and our ambitions should be done for God's glory, not our own. As women, we are called to work with excellence, but our ultimate goal is to serve Christ. What is your ambition in life? Is it to gain wealth, power, or recognition? Or is it to serve the Lord with all your heart? A woman with godly ambition works for a greater reward than any the world can offer.

2025-03-21.title: Peace in the Midst of Trials
2025-03-21.verse: John 16:33 - I have said these things to you, that in me you may have peace. In the world you will have tribulation. But take heart; I have overcome the world.
2025-03-21.text: Jesus never promised us an easy life, but He did promise us His peace. In John 16:33, He says, 'In the world you will have tribulation. But take heart; I have overcome the world.' This is a powerful promise for the woman who is facing trials, worries, and struggles. The peace of Christ is not the absence of problems, but the assurance of His presence in the midst of them. It's a peace that guards our hearts and our minds from anxiety and fear. What tribulation are you facing today? Don't lose heart. Take a moment to rest in the truth that Jesus has overcome the world. His peace is available to you, even in the midst of your trials. His peace is a testament to His victory.

2025-03-22.title: The Armor of a Mother
2025-03-22.verse: Ephesians 6:4 - Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.
2025-03-22.text: A mother's role is not just to provide, but to protect and guide her family. Ephesians 6:4 gives a powerful instruction to fathers, which we can apply to our own role as mothers: 'bring them up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.' A mother who leads with a heart of love and discipline is a fortress for her family. She protects them from the dangers of the world and guides them in the way of righteousness. What does it look like to be a spiritual protector for your family today? Maybe it's by praying for your children, by leading a family devotional, or by having a difficult conversation about the things of the world. A mother's armor is her commitment to her family's spiritual well-being.

2025-03-23.title: A Life of Prayer
2025-03-23.text: In a world of constant noise and distraction, a life of prayer is a radical act of faith. 1 Thessalonians 5:17 encourages us to 'pray without ceasing.' This is not a suggestion, but a command. Prayer is our direct line of communication with our heavenly Father. As women, we are often tempted to solve our problems on our own, but God invites us to bring all our worries and requests to Him. A life of prayer is a life of constant communion with God, where we are open to His will and His guidance. How can you pray without ceasing today? Maybe it's through short, intentional prayers throughout your day, or by setting aside a specific time to be with God. A woman who prays constantly is a woman who walks in the strength of God, not her own.

2025-03-24.title: Leading by Example
2025-03-24.verse: 1 Timothy 4:12 - Let no one despise you for your youth, but set the believers an example in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith, in purity.
2025-03-24.text: True leadership is not just about what you say, but about how you live. 1 Timothy 4:12 gives us a powerful guide for leadership: 'Let no one despise you for your youth, but set the believers an example in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith, in purity.' As women, we are called to lead by example, not just in our words but in our actions. This means living a life of integrity, love, and faith that inspires others to follow Christ. A woman who leads by example is a woman who is authentic and transparent, and her life is a living testament to God's goodness. How can you set an example for others today? Maybe it's through a kind word, a selfless act, or a commitment to excellence in your work. A leader's example is a powerful influence for good.

2025-03-25.title: The Armor of God
2025-03-25.verse: Ephesians 6:13-17 - Therefore take up the whole armor of God, that you may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done all, to stand firm. Stand therefore, having fastened on the belt of truth, and having put on the breastplate of righteousness, and, as shoes for your feet, having put on the readiness given by the gospel of peace. In all circumstances take up the shield of faith, with which you can extinguish all the flaming darts of the evil one; and take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God.
2025-03-25.text: We are in a spiritual battle, and we must be equipped with the right armor. Ephesians 6:13-17 gives us a clear description of the armor of God: the belt of truth, the breastplate of righteousness, the shoes of the gospel of peace, the shield of faith, the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit. This armor is not just for protection; it's a way of life. As women, we are called to be spiritual warriors, and this armor is our defense against the attacks of the enemy. Are you wearing your spiritual armor today? Take a moment to pray and put on each piece of God's armor. Stand firm in the strength of the Lord, and you will be able to overcome.

2025-03-26.title: A Mother's Self-Control
2025-03-26.verse: Titus 2:6-8 - Likewise, urge the younger women to be self-controlled. Show yourself in all respects to be a model of good works, and in your teaching show integrity, dignity, and sound speech that cannot be condemned, so that an opponent may be put to shame, having nothing evil to say about us.
2025-03-26.text: As mothers, we are called to be an example to our children in all things, especially in self-control. Titus 2:6-8 instructs us to be 'self-controlled, dignified, and sound in speech.' A woman of self-control is a woman who is a master of her own desires and impulses. She is not ruled by her emotions or her appetites but is guided by the Holy Spirit. This self-control is a powerful example for our children, teaching them the importance of discipline and virtue. Where do you need more self-control in your life today? Maybe it's with your words, your temper, or your habits. Pray for the Holy Spirit to give you the strength to grow in this area. A mother's self-control is a powerful legacy for her children.

2025-03-27.title: Stewardship of Your Time
2025-03-27.verse: Psalm 90:12 - So teach us to number our days that we may get a heart of wisdom.
2025-03-27.text: Time is a precious gift from God, and we are called to be good stewards of it. Psalm 90:12 prays, 'So teach us to number our days that we may get a heart of wisdom.' This verse reminds us that our time on earth is limited, and we must use it wisely. As women, we are often tempted to waste our time on things that are not eternal. But God calls us to be intentional about how we spend our days, our hours, and our minutes. What are you doing with your time today? Is it bringing you closer to God and to your purpose? Take a moment to reflect on your priorities and make a conscious choice to be a good steward of the time God has given you. A wise woman is a woman who knows how to number her days.

2025-03-28.title: Steadfastness in Faith
2025-03-28.verse: 1 Corinthians 15:58 - Therefore, my beloved sisters, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, knowing that in the Lord your labor is not in vain.
2025-03-28.text: The Christian journey is not a sprint; it's a marathon that requires perseverance. 1 Corinthians 15:58 encourages us to 'be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, knowing that in the Lord your labor is not in vain.' This verse highlights the importance of staying the course, even when we feel like giving up. As women, we are often tempted to get discouraged by our failures or by the lack of immediate results. But God's promises are for those who endure. Perseverance is not just about toughing it out; it's about trusting that God will be faithful to His promises. Where are you in your marathon of faith? Don't give up. Keep your eyes on Jesus and trust that your endurance is a sign of your faith. The promise is for those who persevere.

2025-03-29.title: The Strength to Endure
2025-03-29.verse: Hebrews 12:1-2 - Therefore, since we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, let us also lay aside every weight, and sin which clings so closely, and let us run with endurance the race that is set before us, looking to Jesus, the founder and perfecter of our faith, who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is seated at the right hand of the throne of God.
2025-03-29.text: Life can be a long-distance race, and the Christian journey is no different. Hebrews 12:1-2 encourages us to 'run with endurance the race that is set before us, looking to Jesus, the founder and perfecter of our faith.' The Christian life requires perseverance, the ability to keep going even when we feel like giving up. As women, we are often tempted to get distracted by the 'sin which clings so closely' and to lose sight of the finish line. But our focus should always be on Jesus. He is our ultimate example of perseverance. What is slowing you down in your race? What distraction or sin is weighing you down? Lay it aside today and fix your eyes on Jesus. Run the race with endurance, knowing that He is running with you and will see you through to the end.

2025-03-30.title: The Peace of God
2025-03-30.verse: Philippians 4:6-7 - Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God. And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.
2025-03-30.text: Anxiety is a common struggle for women, but God's peace is our refuge. Philippians 4:6-7 gives us a powerful solution: 'Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God. And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.' This is not a suggestion, but a command to release our anxieties to God through prayer. The peace of God is a supernatural gift that guards our hearts and minds from the attacks of the enemy. What is causing you anxiety today? Bring it to God in prayer with a heart of thanksgiving. Trust that His peace will guard you and give you rest. His peace is a fortress for your soul.

2025-03-31.title: Living with a Purposeful Life
2025-03-31.verse: 2 Timothy 4:7-8 - I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith. Henceforth there is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, will award to me on that day, and not only to me but also to all who have loved his appearing.
2025-03-31.text: As we close out the month, let's reflect on the kind of life we are called to live. 2 Timothy 4:7-8 gives us a powerful reflection from the apostle Paul: 'I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith.' This is a testament to a life lived with purpose, discipline, and faith. As women, we are called to fight the good fight, to run the race with endurance, and to keep the faith. This is a life that is not wasted, but is lived for the glory of God. How are you fighting the good fight and running the race? What purpose is God calling you to live out today? Live with the intentionality of a woman who is finishing her race well, and you will find a life of fulfillment and purpose.
